alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains West (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 25 at 4:17AM MST until January 25 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow expected. Totals will vary widely across the area. The heaviest snow is expected along and north of Highway 14A where total accumulations of 8 to 15 inches are possible. Heavier snow is also expected across higher elevations of the far southern Bighorns where 6 to 12 inches of total snow accumulation is possible. Elsewhere, including along Highway 16, totals will range from 1 to 3 inches. Wind gusts of 30 to 40 mph are possible with the heaviest snow. * WHERE...Bighorn Mountains West. * WHEN...Until 5 PM Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Backcountry enthusiasts including snowmobilers can easily become disoriented and lost. Be prepared if recreating.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
